ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Checks condition for head, neck etc
Checks if condition is ongoing
Checks condition for respiratory
Checks if condition is ongoing - respiratory
Checks condition for circulatory
Checks if condition is ongoing - circulatory
Checks condition for digestive
Checks if condition is ongoing - digestive
Checks condition for Skin
Checks if condition is ongoing - skin
Checks condition for urinary
Checks if condition is ongoing - urinary
Checks condition for musculoskeletal
Checks if condition is ongoing - musculoskeletal
Checks condition for nervous system
Checks if condition is ongoing - nervous
Checks condition for endocrine
Checks if condition is ongoing - endocrine
Checks condition for blood organs
Checks if condition is ongoing - blood organs
Checks condition for other III symptoms
Checks if condition is ongoing - other III
Checks if physical exam was administered
Checks if completed
Subject related information (e.g the affection, phenotype, disease information, etc.).
Site
Study; The code for each individual study
